Package moblima.controller

Class DBController

  • java.lang.Object
    • moblima.controller.DBController
  • public class DBController
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a controller that helps to read/write data from and to database Assist in instantiating all instances of every classes using data stored in database Assist in saving all instances of every classes into database

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static java.lang.String SEPARATOR
      Char used to separate an attribute from another in an instance Necessary to separate data so as to know which belongs to which attribute when creating an instance of a class

        public static java.util.ArrayList readCineplex​(java.lang.String filename)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Read cineplex data from txt file and use the data accordingly to create new cineplex instances Store the cineplex instances into an arrayList to be passed to the MainModel to instantiate Cineplex List
        Parameters:
        filename - Path to a file containing attributes of all cineplexes
        Returns:
        array of cineplex instances
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - the io exception

                                java.util.List cineplexList,
                                java.lang.Boolean append)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Save all cineplex instances into a txt file associated with the filename

        cineplexList - the cineplexList
        append - the boolean value of append

      • saveReview

        public static void saveReview​(java.lang.String filename,
                              java.util.List reviewList,
                              java.lang.String cineplexId,
                              java.lang.String movieId,
                              java.lang.Boolean append)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Save all review instances into a txt file associated with the filename Cineplex id and movie id is necessary to be stored together in the txt file so that we know which review belongs to which movie from which cineplex when reading the txt file
        Parameters:
        filename - Txt file to save all instances of review
        reviewList - the reviewList
        cineplexId - the cineplex id
        movieId - the movie id
        append - the boolean value of append
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - the io exception

      • saveBookingHistory

        public static void saveBookingHistory​(java.lang.String filename,
                                      java.util.List bookingList,
                                      java.lang.String email,
                                      java.lang.Boolean append)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Save all booking instances into a txt file associated with the filename Email is necessary to be stored together in the txt file so that we know which booking belongs to which customer identified by email
        Parameters:
        filename - Txt file to save all instances of booking
        bookingList - the bookingList
        email - the email of a customer
        append - the boolean value of append
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - the io exception

      • saveCinema

        public static void saveCinema​(java.lang.String filename,
                              java.util.List al,
                              java.lang.String cineplexId,
                              java.lang.Boolean append)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the Cinema to Cineplex.
        Parameters:
        filename - The directory to save to.
        al - The content to be saved in directory.
        cineplexId - The Cineplex to store the Cinema in.
        append - If true, add List to the end of existing text, else replace all text in directory with List.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Exception thrown if IO exception failed or interrupted.

        java.io.IOException - Exception thrown if IO exception failed or interrupted.

                          java.util.List data,
                          java.lang.Boolean append)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Write fixed content to the given file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The directory to write to
        data - The data to add to.
        append - If true, add to end of existing database, else replace.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - exception to thrown if IO interrupt or unable to read.
